005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.function.library;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.DynamicContext;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.ISequence;
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.MetapathConstants;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.function.FunctionUtils;
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.function.IArgument;
013import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.function.IFunction;
014import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.IItem;
015import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic.IStringItem;
016import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
017
018import org.apache.commons.lang3.StringUtils;
019
020import java.util.List;
021
022import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
023
024// CPD-OFF
025/**
026 * Implements the XPath 3.1 <a href=
027 * "https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-functions-31/#func-substring-after">fn:substring-after</a>
028 * function.
029 */
030public final class FnSubstringAfter {
031  private static final String NAME = "substring-after";
032  @NonNull
033  static final IFunction SIGNATURE_TWO_ARG = IFunction.builder()
034      .name(NAME)
035      .namespace(MetapathConstants.NS_METAPATH_FUNCTIONS)
036      .deterministic()
037      .contextIndependent()
038      .focusIndependent()
039      .argument(IArgument.builder()
040          .name("arg1")
041          .type(IStringItem.type())
042          .zeroOrOne()
043          .build())
044      .argument(IArgument.builder()
045          .name("arg2")
046          .type(IStringItem.type())
047          .zeroOrOne()
048          .build())
049      .returnType(IStringItem.type())
050      .returnOne()
051      .functionHandler(FnSubstringAfter::executeTwoArg)
052      .build();
053  // CPD-ON
054
055  private FnSubstringAfter() {
056    // disable construction
057  }
058
059  @SuppressWarnings({ "unused", "PMD.OnlyOneReturn" })
060  @NonNull
061  private static ISequence<IStringItem> executeTwoArg(
062      @NonNull IFunction function,
063      @NonNull List<ISequence<?>> arguments,
064      @NonNull DynamicContext dynamicContext,
065      IItem focus) {
066
067    // From the XPath 3.1 specification:
068    // If the value of $arg1 or $arg2 is the empty sequence, or contains only
069    // ignorable collation units, it is interpreted as the zero-length string.
070    IStringItem arg1 = arguments.get(0).isEmpty()
071        ? IStringItem.valueOf("")
072        : FunctionUtils.asType(ObjectUtils.notNull(arguments.get(0).getFirstItem(true)));
073    IStringItem arg2 = arguments.get(1).isEmpty()
074        ? IStringItem.valueOf("")
075        : FunctionUtils.asType(ObjectUtils.notNull(arguments.get(1).getFirstItem(true)));
076
077    return ISequence.of(IStringItem.valueOf(fnSubstringAfter(arg1.asString(), arg2.asString())));
078  }
079
080  /**
081   * An implementation of XPath 3.1 <a href=
082   * "https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-functions-31/#func-substring-after">fn:substring-after</a>.
083   *
084   * @param arg1
085   *          the source string to get a substring from
086   * @param arg2
087   *          the substring to match and find the substring to return after the
088   *          match
089   * @return the substring
090   */
091  @NonNull
092  public static String fnSubstringAfter(
093      @NonNull String arg1,
094      @NonNull String arg2) {
095    return ObjectUtils.notNull(StringUtils.substringAfter(arg1, arg2));
096  }
097}
